arm_group.description: One training session with the simulator.
One training session with a cadaver.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether an ultrasound-guided nerve block simulator
      is effective for the training of the axillary block technique.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study of a Nerve Block Simulator for the Training in Axillary Blocks

detailed_description.textblock:
Ultrasound-guided nerve blocks are becoming the standard of care in patients requiring
      regional anesthesia. Cost-effective training is needed for the implementation of these
      techniques in the global anesthesia practice. Existing simulators are expensive and not
      available in low income countries. The investigators aimed to test an inexpensive simulator
      for the training in this technique.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Anesthesia residents

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous training in regional anesthesia techniques

intervention.description: Axillary nerve anatomy lecture plus training with the simulator.
Axillary nerve anatomy lecture plus training with the cadaver model.

clinical_study.official_title: Simulator Versus Cadaver Training to Perform Ultrasound-guided Axillary Nerve Bocks

overall_official.affiliation: Fundacion Universitaria de Ciencias de la Salud
Fundacion Universitaria de Ciencias de la Salud

primary_outcome.measure: Time to locate axillary nerve in a cadaver
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the procedure, expected average of 30 seconds

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to identify axillary nerve in a cadaver
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the procedure, expected average of 15 seconds

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
